units.title: Pooling and dissociation of organoids into single-cell suspensions
units.text: each condition (Supplementary Fig. 1) were pooled and dissociated into single-cell suspensions, followed by cell hashing with barcoded antibodies and processing for single-cell transcriptome sequencing (3′ mRNA, 10x Genomics; Fig. 1b).
units.rationale: Describes how organoids are prepared for scRNA‑seq.

units.title: Aggregation of pluripotent stem cells into embryoid bodies and neural induction
units.text: pluripotent stem cells (WTC, H9 and HES3 lines; the latter modified to report the expression of the retinal progenitor marker NKX2-1) were aggregated into embryoid bodies and cultured in minimal neural induction media (MNIM) to induce neuroectodermal fates (Fig. 1a).
units.rationale: Outlines the initial step to generate neural organoids.

units.title: Application of morphogen concentration gradients in microfluidic chips
units.text: We apply concentration gradients in microfluidic chips or increasing static concentrations in multi-well plates and observe different patterning dynamics in each scenario.
units.rationale: Shows two delivery methods for morphogen exposure.

units.title: Delivery of patterning molecules in short pulses
units.text: the delivery of sonic hedgehog (SHH), WNT, FGF8, retinoic acid (RA), BMP4 and BMP7 pathway modulators in short pulses over different time windows induces substantial changes in organoid composition.
units.rationale: Specifies how timed morphogen pulses shape organoid fate.

units.title: Cell hashing with barcoded antibodies for multiplexed scRNA‑seq
units.text: followed by cell hashing with barcoded antibodies and processing for single-cell transcriptome sequencing (3′ mRNA, 10x Genomics; Fig. 1b).
units.rationale: Enables multiplexing of samples in the sequencing workflow.

units.title: Measurement of patterning heterogeneity using Shannon diversity index
units.text: We measured the heterogeneity of each patterning condition at multiple time points, concentrations and combinations, and use the Shannon diversity index, where lower scores indicate lower cell-type diversity.
units.rationale: Quantifies cell‑type composition diversity across conditions.

units.title: In situ hybridization chain reaction (HCR) staining to validate regional identities
units.text: In situ hybridization chain reaction (HCR) stainings confirmed the presence of more retinal progenitors (SFRP2+) at lower RA concentrations and more ventralized and posterior fates (FOXA2+) at higher RA concentrations (Fig. 2d and Extended Data Fig. 3l,m).
units.rationale: Provides spatial validation of morphogen‑induced regionalization.

units.title: Single‑cell hashing‑based multiplexed scRNA‑seq workflow
units.text: We established an experimental workflow to systematically test the remarkable effects, using cell hashing-based multiplexed scRNA‑seq.

units.title: Use of SHH morphogen gradient to recapitulate dorsal‑ventral identities
units.text: Finally, we show that an SHH morphogen gradient and discontinuous SHH morphogen steps similarly recapitulate DV identities in developing neural organoids.
units.rationale: Demonstrates a specific patterning strategy for DV axis formation.

units.title: Analysis of cluster enrichment/depletion scores per treatment
units.text: To identify effects of each morphogen at the cell‑type level, we calculated cluster enrichment/depletion scores for each treatment (Fig. 2a–c, Extended Data Figs. 3a–k and 4a,b and Supplementary Table 3).
units.rationale: Describes computational assessment of morphogen impact on cell‑type composition.
